content.text:
# 2021 President's Cup II – Singles

Andrey Kuznetsov
| runner   =  Jason Kubler
| score    = 6–3, 2–1 ret.
| edition  =
| type     = singles doubles
| before_name  = President's Cup – Men's Singles
| before_year  = 2021
| main_name  = President's Cup (tennis)  President's Cup
| after_name  = President's Cup – Men's singles
}}
Max Purcell was the defending champion but chose not to defend his title.
Andrey Kuznetsov won the title after Jason Kubler retired trailing 3–6, 1–2 in the final.
Seeds
Roman Safiullin (withdrew)
#  Sergiy Stakhovsky (second round)
#  Jay Clarke (first round)
#  Hugo Grenier (quarterfinals)
#  Peter Polansky (quarterfinals)
#  Jesper de Jong (second round)
#  Tseng Chun-hsin (second round)
#  Wu Tung-lin (first round)
}}
